intro: Eriogonum tenue, commonly known as the slender buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of northern Mexico. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, and the flowers are usually pink or purple in color. Eriogonum tenue plays an important role in supporting local wildlife, particularly pollinators like bees and butterflies.
